reviews.review_msg: This was the worst course I have ever taken in my four years at SFU. MacLean managed to say nothing in the 13 weeks of class and by week 8 had an attendance rating of maybe 33 %!
No commanding presence at all, very wishy washy, no clear course structure
The worst  professor  I've ever had. You will learn NOTHING from her 'courses'.
If you don't expect to learn anything, but you want to get a bad mark, take her.
Worst teacher I have ever had, hands down.
He inherited this class. Does not like the books assigned. His lectures are clear and concise. Tries to bring the class to the level of most of the students. Very helpful during office hours.

Took 2 classes with him which were moved online due to Covid-19, could tell he was very out of his element teaching over Zoom but he really made the best of it and managed to make the classes engaging. Super knowledgeable prof and great lecturer, still hoping I can take an in person class with him before I graduate.

I appreciated how James was understanding and reasonable when it came to completing assignments, ie. if you explain you are having difficulty he will help you. The lectures, however, were one-sided, and if you did not take the 'left-wing' position, your views were not seen as valid. This class was mostly about  racism. Assignment load was fair.
James won't give out easy As but if you do the work critically and participate in lecture you'll do great.
a dynamic lecturer who will challenge to get beyond your comfort zone in comprehending the subject
James is the best professor at SFU. I love his passion for Poli Sci... If you get the chance, take his classes!!!! He will work you but he's amazing and makes learning enjoyable.
